intro: Monsonia senegalensis, commonly known as the Senegalese monsonia, is a flowering plant native to the dry savannas of West Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its hairy, upright stems and showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils and thrives in full sun, making it well adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are alternate and have a distinctive lobed shape, while its flowers are clustered in terminal inflorescences. Monsonia senegalensis is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
